Bach's monumental Goldberg Variations is captured here on disc in what is virtually a 'live' performance. After four days in the recording studio (in this case, London's wonderful Henry Wood Hall), Angela had every variation on tape, but wanted to try the opening Aria again. Following a massage and Japanese meal, she went back and began to play after 11 p.m. After finishing the theme, her record producer, Ludger Backenhoff, urged her to continue, and she did, giving a complete performance which she felt was far above anything she had done up until that time. Except for some retakes that were done the following day, that is what appears here on the CD. All repeats are observed.

Recorded in Henry Wood Hall, London, on 28 August - 1 September 1999
